title: PREVENTION OF SPREAD OF FIRE
fullText:
Electrical equipment, including switches, socket-outlets and other accessories, shall be arranged to provide a separation of not less than 300 mm horizontally and 600 mm vertically from any opening or recess in the opposite side of a wall, ceiling or floor that is required to be fire-rated (e.g. a 'fire-rated barrier').
The openings made for electrical equipment installed in fire-rated barriers shall not penetrate beyond 50% of the thickness of the barrier.
Any gap between electrical equipment and a fire-rated barrier shall be sealed to the degree of fire-resistance prescribed for the barrier, in accordance with the relevant provisions of the national building codes.
NOTES:
1	Guidance on materials suitable for restoring fire-rated constructions is given in national building codes.
2	National	building	codes	may	have	requirements	for	restoring	acoustic insulation that has been penetrated by electrical equipment.
